item.title: 独家报道美联储主席巴金降息的信心需要通胀的广度收窄
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金表示，他正密切关注商品和服务业通胀的持续广泛性，并认为价格上涨放缓需要更加普遍，然后他才能放心地降息。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve President Thomas Barkin said he is focused intently on the persistent breadth of inflation across goods and services, and feels slower price increases need to be more widespread before he is comfortable cutting interest rates.】

item.title: Cboe Global Markets 寻求美国证券交易委员会批准上市 ETF 股份类别结构
item.description: 美国证券交易所（Cboe Global Markets）周四表示，已向美国证券交易委员会（SEC）提出申请，要求监管部门批准其修改规则，允许发行人在现有共同基金中增加交易所交易基金（ETF）份额类别。【原文：Cboe Global Markets filed a request with the SEC for regulatory approval to change its rules and allow issuers to add an exchange-traded fund (ETF) share class to existing mutual funds, the exchange said on Thursday.】

item.title: 纽约州法官宣布纽约州大麻法规无效
item.description: 在一起质疑大麻广告规则的案件中，纽约州一名法官宣布该州大部分大麻法规无效。【原文：A New York state judge has invalidated most of the state’s cannabis regulations in a case that challenged marijuana advertising rules.】

item.title: 美国希望航空公司提高军人的旅行福利
item.description: 美国运输部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周四敦促美国最大的客运航空公司改善现役军人及其家属的旅行福利。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg on Thursday urged the nation's largest passenger airlines to improve travel benefits for active-duty military personnel and their families.】

item.title: 独家报道美国司法部将会见波音空难受害者律师
item.description: 据路透社通讯报道，美国司法部下周将与2018年和2019年造成346人死亡的两起波音737 MAX致命空难的受害者家属的律师会面，政府将决定是否继续推进刑事案件。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department next week will meet with lawyers for families of victims of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people in 2018 and 2019, as the government decides whether to move ahead with a criminal case, according to correspondence Reuters reviewed.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比称房价压力构成最大通胀风险
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四表示，美国中央银行努力将通胀率恢复到 2% 目标值的最大障碍是住房服务业的价格涨幅持续过大。【原文：The largest impediment to the U.S. central bank's efforts to return inflation to its 2% target rate is the persistence of outsized price increases in the housing services sector, Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称，如果通胀继续停滞不前，2024 年降息将面临威胁
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周四表示，在上个月的美国央行会议上，他为今年的两次降息埋下了伏笔，但如果通胀继续停滞不前，年底前可能不需要降息。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank President Neel Kashkari said on Thursday that at the U.S. central bank's meeting last month he penciled in two interest rate cuts this year but if inflation continues to stall, none may be required by year end.】

item.title: 美国银行称主动型美国基金取得 2007 年以来最佳季度业绩
item.description: 博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）的策略师表示，第一季度主动管理型美国股票基金取得了自 2007 年以来的最佳季度业绩。【原文：Actively managed U.S. equity funds in the first quarter posted their best quarterly out-performance since 2007, BofA Global Research strategists said.】

item.title: 美国小型企业联合会（NFIB）称，美国小型企业再次缩减招聘计划
item.description: 周四公布的一项调查显示，3月份美国小型企业的招聘计划是自2020年5月大流行病停摆导致经济陷入衰退以来最弱的一次，低于一些经济学家视为更广泛就业市场风向标的关键门槛。【原文：Hiring plans among U.S. small businesses in March were the weakest since May 2020 when pandemic shutdowns threw the economy into recession, dropping below a key threshold some economists see as a bellwether for the wider job market, a survey out on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 高盛和摩根士丹利必须面对投资者就 Archegos 倒闭提起的诉讼
item.description: 纽约州一家上诉法院表示，前 ViacomCBS 投资者可以起诉高盛、摩根士丹利和其他为该媒体公司两次股票发行提供担保的银行，维持了银行担心可能会颠覆资本市场的一项裁决。【原文：A New York state appeals court said former ViacomCBS investors may sue Goldman Sachs , Morgan Stanley and other banks that underwrote two stock offerings for the media company, upholding a ruling that banks fear could upend capital markets.】

item.title: 美国针对华为的刑事案件将于 2026 年开审
item.description: 美国司法部指控中国华为公司在伊朗业务方面误导银行等罪名的刑事案件即将于 2026 年 1 月开庭审理。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department's criminal case accusing China's Huawei of misleading banks about the tech company's business in Iran, among other charges, is heading toward a January 2026 trial.】

item.title: 摩根大通重组全球银行业领导层：备忘录
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，摩根大通重组了全球银行部门的领导层。【原文：JPMorgan Chase reorganized its leadership in the global banking division, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普将在与媒体公司联合创始人的纠纷中接受质询
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）定于本月晚些时候接受其社交媒体公司联合创始人律师的质询，这是上周上市的特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）所有权纠纷的一部分。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump is scheduled to be deposed later this month by lawyers for co-founders of his social media company as part of a dispute over ownership in Trump Media & Technology Group , which went public last week.】

item.title: Sigma Lithium 首席执行官不会在当前锂价下出售公司
item.description: Sigma Lithium 的首席执行官在接受路透社采访时表示，不会在目前的锂价水平上出售这家矿商，而是专注于近期的扩张计划。【原文：Sigma Lithium's chief executive won't sell the miner at current lithium price levels and is concentrating on its near-term expansion plans, she told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 巴尔金称，面对 "不那么令人鼓舞 "的数据，美联储有时间考虑降息
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周四表示，在开始降息之前，美国央行有 "时间让通胀的乌云散去"。【原文：The U.S. central bank has "time for the clouds to clear" on inflation before starting to cut interest rates, Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin said on Thursday, comments that endorsed a careful approach to the start of a monetary easing cycle.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，波音和空客正在探讨分割 Spirit Aero 公司业务的框架
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，波音和空客正逐步达成一项潜在的协调协议，分拆陷入困境的供应商 Spirit AeroSystems 的业务，接管支持其顶级喷气机项目所需的工厂。【原文：Boeing and Airbus are edging towards a potentially coordinated deal to split operations of troubled supplier Spirit AeroSystems , taking on plants needed to support their top jet programs, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Glass Lewis 建议投资者投票反对 Spirit Aero 公司的两名董事
item.description: 代理咨询公司 Glass Lewis 建议 Spirit AeroSystems 股东在 2024 年年会上投票反对选举两名董事，其中包括这家航空零部件供应商风险委员会的负责人罗纳德-卡迪什（Ronald Kadish）。【原文：Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis has recommended Spirit AeroSystems shareholders vote against the election of two directors, including the head of the aero parts supplier's risk committee, Ronald Kadish, at the 2024 annual meeting.】

item.title: 美国券商开始红迪覆盖范围，盈利前景存疑
item.description: 两家美国券商在开始报道 Reddit 时，对该社交媒体平台实现盈利的能力持怀疑态度，并对其可能进入 "meme 股票 "俱乐部表示担忧。【原文：Two U.S. brokerages began coverage of Reddit by taking a skeptical stance on the social media platform's ability to turn profitable and raised concerns over its potential entry into the 'meme stock' club.】

item.title: 家乐福与百事可乐之争揭示零售商广告业务的关键作用
item.description: 家乐福和百事公司刚刚解决的为期三个月的价格争议，揭示了此类谈判的一个新方面，它正在改变零售商和供应商之间的关系。【原文：Carrefour and PepsiCo's just resolved three-month price dispute has shed light on a new aspect of such negotiations which is changing the relationship between retailers and suppliers.】

item.title: 亿万富翁乔-刘易斯将因内幕交易罪在美国被判刑
item.description: 英国亿万富翁乔-刘易斯（Joe Lewis）定于周四在美国法院接受宣判，罪名是非法分享他通过投资获得的股票交易技巧。【原文：British multibillionaire Joe Lewis is scheduled to face sentencing in a U.S. court on Thursday for illegally sharing stock tips he gleaned through his investments.】

item.title: 代理顾问敦促高盛将首席执行官和董事长角色分开
item.description: 高盛 代理顾问公司 Glass Lewis 在周四的一份报告中写道，高盛应将目前由大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）担任的首席执行官和董事长职位分开。【原文：Goldman Sachs should separate the CEO and chairman roles currently held by David Solomon, proxy adviser Glass Lewis wrote in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国银行必须面对透支费退款诉讼
item.description: 美国银行必须面对一项诉讼，该诉讼声称美国银行违背了向因 COVID-19 大流行病而面临经济困难的客户退还透支费的承诺。【原文：Bank of America must face a lawsuit claiming it reneged on a promise to refund overdraft fees to customers facing financial hardship because of the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息称凯雷酝酿以 100 亿美元出售标准航空
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）正在权衡各种战略选择，包括出售 StandardAero，可能会将这家美国飞机维修服务提供商的价值（包括债务）估价为 100 亿美元左右。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle Group is weighing strategic options, including a sale, for StandardAero that could value the U.S. aircraft maintenance services provider at about $10 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 直客销售和成本削减见效，利润预期上调，李维斯大涨
item.description: Levi Strauss & Co 的股价周四大涨 20%，创下两年多来的新高，原因是这家牛仔裤生产商上调了年度利润预期，这主要得益于新任首席执行官的成本削减举措和对直接面向客户（DTC）销售的重视。【原文：Shares of Levi Strauss & Co jumped 20% to a more than two-year high on Thursday as the jeans maker raised its annual profit forecast, powered by new CEO's cost-cutting initiatives and a focus on direct-to-customer (DTC) sales.】

item.title: 英伟达、Alphabet引领 3 月市值大涨
item.description: 受人工智能（AI）热情以及对新产品和扩张计划的期待推动，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）和 Alphabet 公司的市值在 3 月份出现了最大涨幅。【原文：Nvidia Corp and Alphabet Inc saw the biggest jump in their market capitalisation in March, driven by artificial intelligence (AI) enthusiasm and anticipation for new products and expansion plans.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，美国将敦促荷兰对ASML在华芯片制造设备采取更多限制措施
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士说，拜登政府计划下周向荷兰施压，阻止其顶级芯片制造设备制造商ASML在中国为一些工具提供服务，因为美国正借助盟友的力量来遏制中国的科技行业。【原文：The Biden administration plans to press the Netherlands next week to stop its top chipmaking equipment maker ASML from servicing some tools in China, two people familiar with the matter said, as the U.S. leans on allies in its bid to hobble Beijing's tech sector.】

item.title: 首席执行官艾格表示，迪士尼将从 6 月起打击密码共享行为
item.description: 迪斯尼公司首席执行官鲍勃-艾格（Bob Iger）周四表示，迪斯尼的流媒体服务将从 6 月开始禁止共享密码，因为这家娱乐集团希望提高用户增长和业务盈利能力。【原文：Walt Disney's streaming service will start cracking down on password-sharing from June, Chief Executive Bob Iger said on Thursday, as the entertainment conglomerate looks to boost subscriber growth and profitability at the business.】

item.title: 解说员：为什么维护 ASML 设备是中美芯片战争的新战线？
item.description: 美国政府呼吁盟国迫使计算机芯片制造设备公司停止维护它们在中国出售的一些工具，这是华盛顿削弱中国生产自己的先进计算机芯片能力的努力之一。【原文：The U.S. government has called on allies to force computer chip manufacturing equipment companies to stop maintaining some of the tools they have sold in China, part of Washington's efforts to undermine China's ability to produce its own advanced computer chips.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 正在权衡对 HubSpot 的收购要约
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 一直在与其顾问商讨收购在线营销软件公司 HubSpot 的可能性，HubSpot 的市值高达 320 亿美元。【原文：Google parent Alphabet has been talking to its advisers about the possibility of making an offer for HubSpot , an online marketing software company with a market value of $32 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 杰富瑞与日本住友将联盟扩展至加拿大
item.description: 杰富瑞金融公司（Jefferies Financial）将通过扩大与日本三井住友银行（SMBC）的合作，加强其在加拿大的业务，以开拓该国的交易市场。【原文：Jefferies Financial will strengthen its presence in Canada through an expanded partnership with Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC), as it looks to tap into the dealmaking market in the country.】
